Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lidless lekanis with handle; interior: glazed black with added red band at transition between rim and bowl; top of rim reserved with red band at outer edge and black band at inner edge; handle black, reserved on inside; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of sphinx (head and legs missing; red on wing and two strokes on ribs), to left; at right, part of another animal, possibly a siren (only chest and start of wing remaining).
Producer name: Painted by: The Polos Painter (ABV p. 46, no. 81)
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Amsterdam, Allard Pierson Museum 1942 (ABV, 45, no. 53; Boardman, J., Athenian Black Figure Vases. London, 1974, fig. 33). For parallels regarding the possible siren, see British Museum 1930,1217.1.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 335, no. B392)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (151, note 67)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0771) (Phase 1)
